previewContent.subtitle: Dark theme is trending and most of the popular app has the feature to turn into the dark mode.

Post:158925112bf9.title: Implement Dark Mode in Flutter using Provider

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_1.name: 60f5
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_1.text: Implement Dark Mode in Flutter using Provider

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_2.text: Hi everyone, In this article, we will be learning how to implement the dark theme in our app using the provider package

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_3.name: 2f85
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_3.text: As we all now Dark theme is trending and most of the popular app has the feature to turn into the dark mode.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_4.name: b3ec
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_4.text: There are two ways to turn on the dark mode in any app:

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_5.name: fd34
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_5.text: 1: Adding a custom option to change to the dark mode (Eg: Twitter, Medium app)

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_7.text: 2: Depends on the Phone system setting (Eg: Instagram)

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_9.name: fc46
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_9.text: We already have both the options in flutter.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_10.name: ea35
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_10.text: If you check the MaterialApp widget you will see

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_12.name: ec73
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_12.text: We have the theme and darkTheme parameter in MaterialApp widget we can provide the dark ThemeData in darkTheme and light ThemeData in theme if we want our app to change the theme according to the system preferences.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_13.name: f424
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_13.text: And if we have a custom button or something to change the dark theme then we just have to put some condition to change it.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_14.name: 4ef3
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_14.text: Let's implement the dark mode to an app

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_18.name: 02df
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_18.text:
dependencies:
  flutter:
    sdk: flutter
  shared_preferences: "<newest version>"
  provider: "<newest version>"

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_19.name: f867
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_19.text:
we are using the SharedPreferences to set the value in the memory so even if we close the app and reopens it, our data won't lose.
Provider is used to manage the state when the dark theme is implemented on the app.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_20.name: e5aa
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_20.text: Step 2: Create a class for SharedPreferences

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_21.name: 7ca2
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_21.text: We are creating a separate class for the SharedPreferences so the code won't mess up.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_23.name: 5a4b
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_23.text: We have created a class DarkThemePreference where we are storing the bool value in for the dark theme, we have two methods for saving and retrieving the bool value.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_24.text: Step 3: Create a model class for provider

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_26.name: 74df
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_26.text: We are accessing the preference value through the provider so whenever there is any change the notifyListeners() UI will be updated if we have attached the provider to the screen.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_27.name: a930
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_27.text: Step 4: Add custom theme data for dark mode

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_28.name: 79d7
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_28.text: if you see we have to provide the ThemeData , so I have created a method for dark and light mode.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_30.name: 7df6
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_30.text: Step 5: Add the provider to Material app

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_32.name: e207
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_32.text: when we run our app the first widget will be MyApp which will have MaterialApp .

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_33.name: 8bc3

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_34.text: Now in the initState of our MyApp we will check for the value that is stored in the SharedPreferences through the Provider.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_35.name: 4ae6

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_36.name: 3bc5
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_36.text: If you see the getCurrentAppTheme method, I am fetching the value from the preferences and set the value in the provider.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_37.name: 043d
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_37.text: Now we will add notifier to the material app which is ChangeNotifierProvider and set a provider model to it, if any change happens in the provider it will notify its descendants.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_39.name: 8d3d
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_39.text: To listen to the changes in the UI we can use Consumer will listen to the changes and update the MaterialApp .

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_40.name: 44ba
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_40.text: We can also use this instead of Consumer<T> .

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_42.name: 6ad3
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_42.text: Final Step: Turn on the dark theme

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_43.name: e9c3
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_43.text: For example, we have a CheckBox through which we are setting the theme.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_44.name: 43bf

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_50.name: f75c
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_50.text: When the value is “true” the provider will set the theme to dark and turn into a light mode when the value is true.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_52.name: a35c
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_52.text: We have successfully learned how to add a dark theme to your app.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_53.text: We also have created a Devfest app for Google Developers Group New Delhi in which we had implemented a dark mode with some animation.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_55.name: 3c6b
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_55.text: Check out the whole code here

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_56.name: 79fb
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_56.text:
flutter-devs/Flutter-Devfest
A new Flutter application. This project is a starting point for a Flutter application. A few resources to get you…github.com

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_58.name: 44ef
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_58.text: If I got something wrong 🙈, Let me know in the comments. I would love to improve.

Paragraph:b292d31e165e_59.name: 02a6
Paragraph:b292d31e165e_59.text: Clap 👏 If this article helps you.
